channel.title: Tutorials on qri
channel.description: Recent content in Tutorials on qri

item.title: CLI Quickstart
item.description: Qri CLI Quickstart Let’s take a tour through the Qri Command line client. Setup Qri First, you’ll need the latest CLI binary. head over to our releases page and install the binary somewhere on your $PATH. You should be able to type qri help and see a nice introductory message. Before we can do useful things with Qri, we need to set it up. So let’s start by running setup:

item.title: FBuilding Qri on Windows
item.description: Building Qri on Windows This page was adapted from a blog post written by friend of the project Jonathan Butler. Step 1: Enable Developer Mode If developer mode isn’t enabled, you may experience permission errors during building. To prevent this, enable developer mode by typing “Developer mode” into the search bar and enabling it. Step 2: Download Go Qri requires Go the programming language and its packages to run.

item.title: Frontend Tutorials
item.description: Frontend Screencast Demos We’ve filmed screencasts of our teammates demonstrating new features to help you get a feel for qri. Check out some of them below. Please note! We’re improving qri every day. Some of these videos, while still useful, may not reflect the most current state of the app. Screencast Demo - 0.6.1 (filmed Dec 17, 2018) What’s covered: Navigation How to add datasets published by other peers Defining published vs.
